solution_line_template: Kendra wears {shirts_per_weekday} * {num_weekdays} = <<{shirts_per_weekday}*{num_weekdays}={school_day_shirts}>>{school_day_shirts} shirts for school days.
She wears {shirts_per_club_day} * {num_club_days} = <<{shirts_per_club_day}*{num_club_days}={club_shirts}>>{club_shirts} extra shirts for her after-school club.

With her shirt on Saturday, she wears {school_day_shirts} + {club_shirts} + {saturday_shirt} + {sunday_shirts} = <<{school_day_shirts}+{club_shirts}+{saturday_shirt}+{sunday_shirts}={total_shirts_per_week}>>{total_shirts_per_week} shirts each week.

She wants to have {num_weeks_laundry_cycle} weeks' worth of shirts, so she needs {total_shirts_per_week} * {num_weeks_laundry_cycle} = <<{total_shirts_per_week}*{num_weeks_laundry_cycle}={total_shirts_needed}>>{total_shirts_needed} shirts.
